## Matthias Leimeister
Hi, I'm a DSP research engineer at [Native Instruments](www.native-instruments.com), working in the area of music information retrieval. Before I was at [Fraunhofer IDMT](www.idmt.fraunhofer.de) as a research student for the project [Songs2See](http://songs2see.com), completed an M.Sc. in Media Technology at [TU Ilmenau](www.tu-ilmenau.de/mt) with a focus on audio coding and analysis, and a diploma in mathematics at [Ruprecht-Karls-University Heidelberg](https://www.mathinf.uni-heidelberg.de/). Besides music analysis and processing, I'm also interested in speech recognition, computer vision and natural language processing. You can find some of my private projects at @mleimeister.

### Publications
Richard Vogl, Matthias Leimeister, Carthach O Nuanain, Sergi Jorda, Michael Hlatky, Peter Knees: An Intelligent Interface for Drum Pattern Variation and Comparative Evaluation of Algorithms. J. Audio Eng. Sco. Special Issue on Intelligent Audio Processing, Semantics, and Interaction, 2016.

Matthias Leimeister: Feature Learning for Classifying Drum Components from Nonnegative Matrix Factorization. Proceedings of the 138th AES Convention, Warsaw, 2015.

Matthias Leimeister, Csanad Egervari, Felix Kuhnke, Anja Chilian, Charlott Voigt, Tamas Harczos: Simple spectral subtraction method enhances speech intelligibility in noise for cochlear implant listeners. International symposium on auditory and audiological research, Nybork, 2015.

Matthias Leimeister, Daniel GaÌˆrtner, Christian Dittmar: Rhythmic Classification of Electronic Dance Music. Proceedings of the AES 53rd Conference on Semantic Audio, London, 2013.

### Theses
Implementation and evaluation of a system for drum pattern detection and retrieval in polyphonic music. M.Sc. thesis, TU Ilmenau, 2013.

Comparison and implementation of audio pre-processing algorithms for cochlea implants. M.Sc. project, TU Ilmenau, 2012.

Deformation of CMC surfaces in hyperbolic 3-space. Diploma thesis, Heidelberg University, 2010.

### Talks
Connectionist temporal classification. [Berlin Machine Learning Seminar](http://berlin-machine-learning-seminar.org/2016/10/25/connectionist-temporal-classification/), November 2016.

Music similarity and speaker recognition - what do they have in common? [Berlin Machine Learning Seminar](http://berlin-machine-learning-seminar.org/2016/05/02/music-similarity-and-speaker-recognition-what-do-they-have-in-common/), November 2016.

Audio source separation for music and speech analysis. Lecture course [Current topics in media informatics](http://schirmacher.beuth-hochschule.de/lehre/atm-2015ws.html), Beuth Hochschule Berlin, November 2015.

Nonnegative matrix factorization for audio source separation. [Berlin Machine Learning Seminar](http://berlin-machine-learning-seminar.org/2016/03/30/nonnegative-matrix-factorization-for-audio-source-separation/), August 2015.
